noun.description: A voucher entitling the holder to a discount for a particular product.
A form in a newspaper or magazine that may be filled in and sent as an application for a purchase or information.

verb.description: (of a business) issue or distribute coupons or vouchers offering discounts on particular goods or services.
examples: the company announced plans to reduce its couponing and just cut prices instead

origin: Early 19th century (denoting a detachable portion of a stock certificate): from French, literally piece cut off, from couper cut, from Old French colper (see cope).
